cleaned_text: Meditation Timer Pro 4+ Simple Insight and Zen Timer [ ](https://apps.apple.com/us/developer/%E5%80%A9-%E8%B5%B5/id376557917) Designed for iPhone - - $1.99 - Offers In-App Purchases Screenshots Description No matter if you are going to join meditators, a beginner or practice meditation for a long time, Meditation Timer Pro can help you do it better. You can just focus on meditation without thinking about the time. Meditation is a classic, simple and inexpensive way to lead you into wonderful state of inner peace and inner calm, and it helps to keep you relax from anxious, tense, worried etc and also stress reduction, meditation enhance your physical, mental and emotional wellbeing. With Meditation Timer Pro, you can practice meditation anywhere and anytime. Key Features: Default meditations and you can custom you own. With prepare time, interval time and cool down time. Set unique sound for beginning, interval switching, ending and cool down end. Sounds play one, two or three times. Ten amazing background pictures, shake to change. Start, stop, restart or resume meditation. Hide the time. Save meditation logs automatically and you can add logs manually. Powerful statistics function. Create unlimited reminders to remind you practicing meditation. Passwords protection. Vibrate or not when switching sections. With or without sound. Support iPod media background. Share to Facebook or Twitter. Adds 3D Touch function. Supports Apple Watch version. Supports Today Widget. Supports transferring data to Health app. Supports Dropbox backup and restore. Supports iCloud backup and restore. Apple Health Meditation Timer Pro is able to write meditate data only according to your permissions and preferences. If allowing MEDITATION to write data, you could transfer the meditate data to Health App easily. If you have any question or suggestion, please contact us by maxwellsoftware@gmail.com. What's New Version 5.0.1 Minor bug fixed. Ratings and Reviews Update: bug seems to be fixed I think this bug was fixed a while back so I'm updating this here. I think this is one of, if not the best meditation timers out there. It works just the way I want it to. I don't use a lot of the extra features but it does exactly what I want in a meditation timer and it does it smoothly and simply. I just figured out that this app was the culprit for draining the battery rapidly on my iPhone. It seems that it isn't releasing the audio circuitry, and that drains the battery about three times as fast as it normally would!! Other than that I like the app, but I have to advise everyone to stay away from it until this bug is fixed. If you must use it, make sure to manually quit the app by swiping up on it in the task manager after each use, this will force it to stop draining the battery. Mostly Works! Using this on an iPhone 6S and love it. Very complete-seeming after reading reviews of several meditation timers. I agree that some of the sounds are utterly out of place in an app like this. Not sure who's need is met with some and would like more chime-type options. Not a problem if that never happens. The variability and options make this great for me. On the iPad Mini 4 this app has a hard time. Either there are no chime sounds, chimes ring repeatedly, (yeah, like over and over), or it won't run a saved/titled meditation at all. Now sometimes it does work on the iPad, but I've given up on that device with this app. BTW, I'm not having trouble with any other app on it. Would also prefer to use the app on the iPad to save on phone battery use. So I use it on the phone. Oh, and please note: it's true that if you don't close the app after use, it will continue to use up your battery. That said, love it. Works great I've had no problems with this meditation timer and I've been using it for years. I have a few meditations I've set up (with different lengths, intervals, etc.) for my typical daily/weekly routine. The only feature that would make this timer better for me would be a "volume test". Currently I always start a meditation so I can hear the volume level for the current bell then immediately end it if the volume is too loud or quiet. Then I adjust the volume and start again. If there were a button next to the start button for just testing the volume, that would help me. However, the app is configurable and the UI is straightforward enough for me to never want to look for another mediation app again. The quality and variety of bells are nice. Incidentally, I find the timer configurable enough to be useful in other practices. So I have a timer for stretching and yoga which repeatedly reminds me when to switch stretches or poses. Then a different bell signals when I've completed the amount of time I want to spend stretching or practicing yoga. Really nice.
